title: Geth build failed error 2
body:
Running go-ethereum on Ubuntu Trusty Tahr 14.04
Running for months, then after a recent update, I uninstalled some libraries (sudo apt-get purge ethminer eth libethereum) from an initial build because my gpus would not connect. 

I resolved to create another mining instance. I created a new directory and new miner, however, I can not make geth. I get a geth error 2. Here is the make, with errors (after the 2nd runtime):

newInstall/go-ethereum$ make geth ...
newInstall/go-ethereum$ make geth
build/env.sh go install -v -ldflags '-X main.gitCommit 54904...8' -tags opencl ./cmd/geth
crypto/rsa
runtime/trace
# runtime/trace

/usr/lib/go/src/runtime/trace/trace.go:23: undefined: runtime.StartTrace
/usr/lib/go/src/runtime/trace/trace.go:28: undefined: runtime.ReadTrace
/usr/lib/go/src/runtime/trace/trace.go:41: undefined: runtime.StopTrace
# crypto/rsa

/usr/lib/go/src/crypto/rsa/rsa.go:93: undefined: crypto.DecrypterOpts
/usr/lib/go/src/crypto/rsa/rsa.go:98: use of .(type) outside type switch
make: **\* [geth] Error 2

UPDATE 1: I went back to the original go-ethereum build, re-installed cpp-ethereum, and the GPUs are at least connecting now. Initial JSON-RPC error, then connecting and after loading miner header, get a BUS error, and fails. Restarted miners, DAG loaded, everything is running fine. No more hashrate display, however. So far so good with the cpp-ethereum re-install.

Here is the full build text:

make geth
build/env.sh go install -v -ldflags '-X main.gitCommit 5490437...8' -tags opencl ./cmd/geth

make: **\* [geth] Error 2
What Go version do you have installed? Seems to me that Go is either old, or the libraries went missing somehow.
Go is Version 1.4.0. I re-installed cpp-ethereum, and the gpus are communicating, and mining fine. Thank you.

The things the failures are referencing were introduced in Go 1.5. However, Geth AFAIK can build with Go 1.4 too. It seems to me that some Go 1.5 libraries are listed somehow in a path that Go 1.4 picks up on your system. Please make sure you don't have two conflicting versions being used at the same time. Perhaps you installed Go from the official Ubuntu repos and a second version from the Ethereum repos, and the package manager didn't match them up properly?

For the initial install, I cloned Go from github: git clone
https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum. I also used the ethererum
repository: add-apt-repository ppa:ethereum/ethereum , and installed the
library: apt-get install -y build-essential libgmp3-dev golang.

This installation is a puzzle to me, and doesn't make a lot of sense,
because I used a guide for the go-ethereum installation. I am unsure how to
detect the library versions, or library store, in my current build, in
order to eliminate an offending library or reference. I'll search for
another reference regarding the library stores, however, the ethereum rig
is operational at this point.

Thank you for the information.

On Tue, Dec 29, 2015 at 2:16 AM, Péter Szilágyi notifications@github.com
wrote:
